security: Revealing a watch list of individuals and the request to monitor their activities, including sharing the list with liaison services and border control, could expose intelligence-gathering methods and compromise the privacy and safety of the listed individuals. Quoting directly: "This list may be passed to liaison for traces and border watch listing. Pls attempt to contirn the wherfabouts of the individuals if they are listed as last being in your area."
summary: A secret CIA message from September 1970 directs multiple European stations to report information on individuals listed on a watch list that might affect the security of the President during his European trip, instructing them to confirm whereabouts and share the list with liaisons for traces and border control.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret message, dated September 22, 1970, instructs CIA stations in Vienna, Brussels, Copenhagen, London, Helsinki, Paris, Bonn, Berlin, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Munich, Rome, Milan, Luxembourg, The Hague, Oslo, Lisbon, Madrid, Stockholm, Bern, Geneva, and Zurich to report any information related to the activities, including travel, of listed individuals that might impact the security of the President during his upcoming European trip; the stations are instructed to confirm the whereabouts of these individuals and are authorized to share the list with liaison services for traces and border watch listing, forwarding all information via immediate precedence cable to HQS, Rome, Madrid, and London.
title: Request for Information on Individuals on Watch List
locations_mentioned: 20 Tower Rd, Strawberry Hill, Twickenham Middlesex, England
recipient: VIENNA, BRUSSELS, COPENHAGEN, LONDON, HELSINKI, PARIS, BONN, BERLIN, FRANKFURT, HAMBURG, MUNICH, ROME, MILAN, LUXEMBOURG, THE HAGUE, OSLO, LISBON, MADRID, STOCKHOLM, BERN, GENEVA, ZURICH
